The President of Madagascar, Andry Rajoelina, has reportedly fled the country after boarding a French military aircraft. 
Earlier, much of the country's military - including the CAPSAT unit - defected in support of ongoing protests sparked by poor access to electricity and water. CAPSAT has since stated that they will assume control over all branches of the military.

The President of Madagascar, Andry Rajoelina, has reportedly fled the country after boarding a French military aircraft. 
Earlier, much of the country's military - including the CAPSAT unit - defected in support of ongoing protests sparked by poor access to electricity and water. CAPSAT has since stated that they will assume control over all branches of the military.

Footage showing a Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on a Ukrainian HIMARS system. 
A reconnaissance drone tracked its movement back to its storage location, which then sent the coordinates to an OTRK installation to launch the Isknander.
Dobropillya Front according to each mapper: Mine, Suriyak, Radov, AMK, Playfra, Hudson, Kalibrated, DeepState, LostArmour, Divgen
Dobropillya Front according to each mapper: Mine, Suriyak, Radov, AMK, Playfra, Hudson, Kalibrated, DeepState, LostArmour, Divgen
Some of these maps are a little outdated, but its interesting nonetheless.

In the Stepnohirsk direction, Ukrainian forces have launched a series of counterattacks aimed at reversing the Russian progress over the past few months.
In the west, Ukrainian forces pushed through the grey zone in Prymorske, recapturing positions in the southern dachas towards the dried-up inlet. Other forces cleared isolated pockets of Russian soldiers in the dachas around Pokrovska Street, moving southeast through the streets near the railway line, and capturing the Prymorske railway station.
To the east, Ukrainian forces cleared the remaining Russian positions on the western outskirts of Stepnohirsk, in the dachas, and in nearby the forested areas, reaching the northern bank of the small river. Other forces were able to cross the river over the E-150 Highway, and capture positions on the southern bank around the overpass. 
Meanwhile, Russian forces continued their attempts at infiltrating southern Stepnohirsk from the 3rd Microdistrict, however Ukrainian drone coverage is preventing them from consolidating. The grey zone remains. 
+ ~1.67 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

In the Stepnohirsk direction, Ukrainian forces have launched a series of counterattacks aimed at reversing the Russian progress over the past few months.  In the west, Ukrainian forces pushed through the grey zone in Prymorske, recapturing positions in the‚Ä¶

Regarding Zelensky's claim of "counteroffensive" actions in western Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
In the post above, I talked about confirmed Ukrainian advances in Stepnohirsk and Prymorske, however the claims of Ukrainian advances extend to Stepove, Mali Shcherbaky, and Shcherbaky. 
Ukrainian forces were able to enter Mali Shcherbaky and raise a flag in the western part of the village, however no consolidation has taken place, and Russian forces are attempting to clear them out of this grey zone. 
As for Stepove and Shcherbaky, there is no evidence of Ukrainian advances being made. Neither of these two villages were under full Russian control, so advances would theoretically be easier.

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces continued to advance and have once again recaptured the village of Dorozhnje.
Following the failed Ukrainian Bradely AFV attack on Russian positions east of Doroznje, Russian forces counterattacked from the forests west of Nykanorivka, crossing over the fields into the Doroznje Freight Train Station. The village was once again brought under full Russian control, with Russian forces consolidating in the treeline to the north, and railway windbreaks to the south. 
Meanwhile, the frontline was corrected in favour of Ukraine to the south, with Ukrainian forces retaining control over the treeline south of Dorozhnje. The grey zone extends as far as the southwestern outskirts of Nykanorivka. 
Russia is also accumulating new groups of soldiers in the Hektova Balka Gulley north of Nykanorivka in preparation for assault operations on the village of Ivanivka. 
+ ~1.57 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Dobropillya and Druzhkivka directions, both Russian and Ukrainian forces have advanced, each reversing the other's progress in different areas.
In the west, Russian forces consolidated in the northern part of Kucheriv Yar, and begun attacks outside the village. They were able to advance into the forested areas to the north, and the treelines to the northwest, taking up new positions there. DRGs also began infiltrating north up the road and have reached the southern outskirts of Zolotyi Kolodyaz. Other forces began advancing up the gulley in the direction of Hruzke, while the Ukrainians attempt to gain a foothold in the positions to the rear. 
To the south, Russian forces advanced downhill from the tactical heights into the forested areas, improving their positions in the direction of Shakhove. Other forces continued their attacks towards the western outskirts of Shakhove, but continue to be repelled by the Ukrainian garrison. 
Additionally, to the west, the frontline was corrected, with Vilne now being in the grey zone. Last week, some Russian soldiers were able to enter part of the village but were unable to consolidate. The village was not brought under control, unlike what I previously stated. However, Russian forces are attempting to advance from the treelines to the southwest in the direction of Vilne, but it is unclear if they have had any successes. 
On the other hand, Ukrainian forces continued their counterattacks in the Druzhkivka direction and have eliminated the Russian spearhead to Sofiivka. They were able to clear the northern and northeastern outskirts of the village, and began advancing west down a treeline, while other forces pushed south down the treelines to the north. Once these positions were recaptured, the Ukrainians began attacking towards the groves to the southeast, infiltrating towards the Russian positions along the western bank of the reservoir. Russian FAB/KAB glide-bombs are targeting these areas, but the majority of them miss the positions (by up to 250 metres) and fall in the fields. 
To the south, Russian forces are also continuing their attacks under artillery and FPV drone cover through the gulley towards the Ukrainian strongpoints, but their advance is being impeded by Ukrainian FPV drone strikes. They have been unable to make any progress here for some time now. 
+ ~5.15 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~5.12 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

On the northeastern flank of Kostyantynivka, Russian forces resumed assault operations north of Chasiv Yar and have crossed the Siverskyi Donets Canal. 
Russian forces advanced from their positions in the treelines and forested areas northwest of Hryhorivka, crossing the canal and establishing control over a series of trench lines and dugouts along the windbreak on the western bank of the canal. They also began pushing north up a treeline towards the southeastern outskirts of Novomarkove. All of these positions are situated on the tactical heights. 
+ ~0.30 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

On the northern flank of Siversk, Russian forces continued to advance and have entered the village of Dronivka.
In the east, Russian forces established full control over the village of Rudnik, capturing its southwestern residential sector, as well as the adjacent chalk quarry. From there, other forces began attacking from the north, pushing south through the forests, and reaching the northern bank of the Bakhmutovka River. They were able to cross over the bridge and gain a foothold in the northern streets of Dronivka. 
Meanwhile, after capturing the mine, Russian forces advanced west down the gulley to the Bakhmutovka River, before crossing it and gaining a foothold in the windbreaks on either side of the railway tracks. They then accumulated additional soldiers, and pushed northwest into the southeastern part of Dronivka, capturing positions in the first residential street. The Russians are attempting to advance further, and fighting is now ongoing for areas closer towards the centre of the village.
In the west, after capturing the trench networks next to the railway bridge, Russian forces continued to advance south down the western bank of the Siverskyi Donets River, where they established control over additional positions in the forests there. 
+ ~8.43 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Khotin direction, Russian forces resumed assault operations northwest of Oleksiivka, and have further improved their tactical position in the area.
Newly arrived Russian reinforcements advanced from the treelines near the international border to the lightly forested gulleys west and northwest of Oleksiivka, establishing control over previously lost positions. This brought the road used by Ukrainian forces to supply their forces stationed in the agricultural complex on the western outskirts of Oleksiivka, and to attack into the residential part of the village, under Russian fire control.
+ ~2.70 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Trump Pledges To Solve Pakistani-Afghan Crisis After Deadly Border Clashes 
Dozens of Pakistani and Afghan troops were killed in border clashes that took place on October 11 and 12, bringing the two countries close to war.
The escalation began on October 9, when Afghanistan accused Pakistan of launching strikes against the capital, Kabul, and a market in the province of Paktika. The strikes reportedly targeted senior members of the Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), which is more commonly known as the Pakistani Taliban, including the group‚Äôs leader Noor Wali Mehsud.
Islamabad had before demanded the Taliban to take action against the TTP who have stepped up attacks in Pakistan, saying they operate from havens in Afghanistan. Kabul, from its side, denied that the group is active on its soil.
üëâ

North Korean Troops Who Fought In Russia‚Äôs Kursk Marched In Pyongyang Parade 
North Korean troops who participated in the battle against Kiev forces in Russia‚Äôs Kursk marched on October 10 at Kim Il-sung Square in Pyongyang in a large parade meant to mark the 80th-anniversary of the founding of the Workers‚Äô Party of Korea.
The battle of Kursk broke out in August of last year, when Kiev forces, backed by foreign mercenaries, infiltrated the region.
With the support of thousands of North Korean troops, the Russian military liberated Kursk in a major counterattack last March.

Russian Army Took Out Ukraine‚Äôs Latest ‚ÄòVAMPIRE‚Äô Air Defense System With Lancet Drone
Russia‚Äôs Rubikon advanced unmanned technology center published on October 13 video footage showing, for the first time, the destruction of an American-made Vehicle-Agnostic Modular Palletized ISR Rocket Equipment (VAMPIRE) short-range air defense system of Kiev forces.
The system was targeted with a Lancet loitering munition, according to the center, which said that the strike took part some 47 kilometers behind the frontline in the Sumy direction, without elaborating.
The VAMPIRE was developed by L3Harris Technologies mainly to counter drones. The system consists of an electro-optical targeting system, typically a Canadian-made WESCAM MX-10D, and a four-barreled Advanced Precision Kill Weapon System (APKWS) rocket launcher that can be mounted on trucks.
üëâ

Ukraine's Cyber Front: Can Digital Defense Halt a Conventional Advance?
This is a new, advanced branch of the Ukrainian army. Kyiv intends to launch an offensive against Russian infrastructure. What are Zelensky's realistic chances of implementing his plans?
War has long been waged on land, at sea and in the air. Now, invisible battles are being fought on the fields of the World Wide Web. The concept adhered to by the world's leading powers is simple: it is pointless to bomb a target factory for months on end, wasting energy, time and, most importantly, expensive ammunition. It is possible to paralyse the desired target with the help of hackers via the internet, completely depriving it of its ability to function.
In recent months, there have been large-scale disruptions at major European airports, such as Heathrow in the UK, Berlin-Brandenburg in Germany, and Zaventem in Belgium. These flight delays and cancellations have cost the European Union millions of dollars. 
üëâ

Russian Army Makes More Gains From Kharkiv To Donetsk
The Russian military made more gains in several areas in the Kharkiv direction, as well in the direction of Donetsk, according to reports from October 13.
To the north of the city of Kharkiv, the Zapad [West] Group of Forces repelled another Ukrainian counter attack on its positions on the left bank of the Volchya River in Volchansk, in the forest west of Synelnykove. Fierce battles are reported to be still taking place there.
A bit to the southeast, the group has reportedly advanced some half a kilometer from Melovoye in the direction of Khatneye.
üëâ
